intro: Monteverdia maestrensis, commonly known as the Maestrense Monteverdia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Colombia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often clinging to tree trunks or rocks. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and prominent yellow stamens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
